shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 5r-177v, 178r-179v) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 5r-138v, 178r-179v) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 139r-154r) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 154r-162v) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 163ra-173rb) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 173rb-177va)
Additiones 1-3.

donors.donor: Names of Fasilädäs (fols. 12r, 29r, 93v, 108v, 138v), Gäbrä Ḥǝywät (fols. 55v, 93v, 138v), ʾabunä Wäldä Śǝllase (fols. 93v, 138v, 179r), Wäldä Gärima (fol. 138v) are written in the supplication formulas added by a secondary crude hand, the same which wrote the names of the days of the week.

txstates.txstate: The front board is broken and repaired with a cord and with leather strips; the back board is missing. At least one fol. is missing, between fols. 59 and 60 (containing a part of Ps. 66 ans Ps. 67). Fols. 178 and 179 are misplaced: fol. 178 should follow fol. 131v; fol. 179 should follow fol. 125v. Fol. 53 is placed in the reversed position. Many fols. are stained with wax and some are stained with water. The edges of many fols. are uneven.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board is broken and repaired; the back board is missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Some quires are reinforced by parchment guards (s. fols. 12v; 118r; 125v; 132r; 140r-147v; 156r-163v).

squires.squire:
A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – II(8+1/fols. 13r-21v/s.l. 9: fol. 21) – III(6/fols. 22r-27v) – IV(10/s.l. 1: fol. 28; 10: fol. 37/28r-37v) – V(6/fols. 38r-43v) – VI(10/ s.l. 1: fol. 44; 10: fol. 53/ fols. 44r-53v) – VII(6/fols. 54r-59v) – VIII(8/fols. 60r-67v) – IX(8/fols. 68r-75v) – X(8/fols. 76r-83v) – XI(10/fols. 84r-93v) – XII(8/fols. 94r-101v) – XIII(8+1/ s.l. 9, fol. 110/ fols. 102r-110v) – XIV(6+1/ s.l. 7, fol. 117/ fols. 111r-117v) – XV(8/fols. 118r-125v) – XVI(8-2/fols. 126r-131v) – XVII(8/fols. 132r-139v) – XVIII(8/fols. 140r-147v) – XIX(8/fols. 148r-155v) – XX(8/fols. 156r-163v) – XXI(6/fols. 164r-169v) – XXII(8/fols. 170r-177v).
Fols. 178 and 179, have been extracted from their proper places (fol. 178 should follow fol. 131v; fol. 179 should follow fol. 125v) and attached to the back of quire XXII.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data are for fol. 13r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data are for fol. 165r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Numeral ፮ “six” looks like compressed numeral ፯ “seven” (e.g., fols. 25r, 34r, 59v, 103r).

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra ( name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5); titles and numbers of the Pss. and Canticles; numbers of Songs; title of Texts I-2, I-3, I-5; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; doxology at the end of each Song; refrains of Texts I-4 and I-5 (written out fully or abbreviated); elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.
Two lines on the incipit page of Text I-1; a few lines (alternating with black lines) in the incipit page of Text I-4.

abbreviations.abbreviation: Text I-4 ሰአ፡ ቅድስት፡/ሰአ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ሠረቀ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fol. 163ra-vb) እስመ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 164rb-165vb) ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 166rb-167vb) ነዓብየኪ፡ for ነዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 168va-169vb) ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fol. 170rb-vb) ተፈሥሒ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 171va-172ra) ወበ: እንተዝ፡ for ወበ: እንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 172va-173ra) Text I-5 ሰ፤ ለ፤ ቅ፤ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ወበ:/ወበ: እንተዝ፡ for ወበ: እንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 174rb-177ra

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Traditional titles of the Pss. are missing. - Traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118 is missing. - A few mistakes in the numbering of the Pss.

desccontent.details:
The Ethiopic Psalter usually includes:
I) Mäzmurä Dawit "Psalms of David"
II) Mäḥaləyä näbiyat "The Canticles of the Prophets"
III) Mäḥaləyä mäḥaləy "Song of Songs"
IV) Wəddase Maryam “Glory of Mary”
V) Anqäṣä bərhan “The Gate of Light”.

edition.text: K. STOFFREGEN-PEDERSEN, Traditional Biblical Exegesis of the Book of Psalms, Wiesbaden 1995 (AeF 36); TÄSFA GÄBRÄ ŚǝLLASE zä-bǝḥerä Bulga, Mäzmurä Dawit. Ṡälotatä näbiyat, wä- mäḫalǝyä Sälomon, wǝddase Maryam mǝslä anqäṣä bǝrhan…, Addis Abäba 1991 (many different editions).

desccontent.text: II) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets”

edition.text: TÄSFA GÄBRÄ ŚǝLLASE zä-bǝḥerä Bulga, Mäzmurä Dawit. Ṡälotatä näbiyat, wä-mäḫalǝyä Sälomon, wǝddase Maryam mǝslä anqäṣä bǝrhan…, Addis Abäba 1991 E.C.

desccontent.details: First Song of Moses (Ex. 15:1–19): fols. 133r-140r; Second Song of Moses (Deut. 32:1–21): fols. 140r-141v; Third Song of Moses (Deut. 32:22–43): fols. 141v-143v; Song of Hannah (I Sam. 2:1–10): fols. 143v-144v; Prayer of Hezekiah (Is. 38:10–20): fols. 144v-145v; Prayer of Manasseh (apocryphal): fols. 145v-146v; Song of Jonah (Jon. 2:3–10): fols. 146v-147r; First Song of the Three Youths in the Furnace (Dan. 3:26–45): fols. 147r-148r; Second Song of the Three Youths (Dan. 3:52–56): fols. 148r-148v; Third Song of the Three Youths (Dan. 3:57–88): fols. 148v-150r; Song of Habakkuk (Hab. 3:1–19): fols. 150r-151v; Song of Isaiah (Is. 26:9–20): fols. 152r-152v; Song of Our Lady Mary (Lk. 1:46–55): fols. 152v-153r; Song of Zachariah (Lk. 1:68–79): fols. 153r-153v; Song of Simeon (Lk. 2:29–32): fols. 153v-154r.

edition.text: H.C. GLEAVE, The Ethiopic Version of the Song of Songs, London 1951; TÄSFA GÄBRÄ ŚǝLLASE zä-bǝḥerä Bulga, Mäzmurä Dawit. Ṡälotatä näbiyat, wä- mäḫalǝyä Sälomon, wǝddase Maryam mǝslä anqäṣä bǝrhan…, Addis Abäba 1991 E.C.

desccontent.details: The text divided into the portions according to the days of the week; incipits of the portions are rubricated.

desccontent.text: V) Anqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light”

literature.text: EAE I, 278b-279b; C. LASH, “‘Gate of Light’: An Ethiopian Hymn to the Blessed Virgin”, Eastern Church Review 4, 1972, 36-46; ibid. 5, 1973, 143-156.

desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 177va: For the third hour. I salute your feet at the time of the third hour, that stood  in front of Pilate, Jesus the Wise and the King Fema who made powerless the force of Satan. G[lory to you!] While they were stripping off your clothes and your white tunic, since they put a scarlet robe upon you, Jesus, the King of Judah...

additional.cont: Fols. 1va-3rb: Hymn to St. Mary Bǝḍǝˁǝt ˀanti… “Blessed you are…”, incomplete.
additional.tran: Fol. 1va: Halleluja, halleluja, halleluja! Blessed are you and the Queen of Righteousness, you who despise, Mary, the seat of mockery… [fol. 3rb] Mary, make your powerful voice heard, which ensnares the enemy, the Serpent, for he has multiplied violence and iniquity.
additional.det: The note is written in a crude hand. Cp. ChRep no. 292; GrohHymn 30; Mäṣḥafä säʿatat mǝslä kwǝllu ṣäwatǝwihu wä-baḥrä ḥassab, Aśmära 1975 E.C., 208-223 (“Sǝbḥatä fequr”). O. RAINERI, “L’inno mariano etiopico «Beṣeʕet anti» (Beata sei) del «Sebḥata Fequr» (Celebrazione del diletto)”, OrChrP 52, 1986, 421-431.

additional.cont: Fols. 3va-4rb: Sǝbḥatä fǝqur zä-Giyorgis “Praise of the Beloved St. George”.
additional.tran: Fol. 3va: We are offering to you the praise and tribute, for the star of Lydda... For the sake of the holy prayer of Ewosṭatewos, our father, Christ, our God and our Savior, quickly listen to our supplication.
additional.det: The prayer is written in the same crude hand as Additio 1. Cp. Ms. St. Petersburg, Koriander 1, fol. 37 (TurPet 76, no. 31). The hymn under the same title included in the edition Mäṣḥafä säʿatat mǝslä kwǝllu ṣäwatǝwihu wä-baḥrä ḥassab, Aśmära 1975 E.C., 223-229, shares with the given text only a few lines, the rest is dissimilar.

extras.extra: - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by a line of alternating black and red dots. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the whole line or the end of the line: fols. 29r, 61r, 73v, 75r, 79v, 88v, 91r, 96r, 115r, 123r. - Ethiopic numerals ፻፻ are written beside a verse of a Ps. or a Canticle on fols. 6r-153r. - Omitted letters and words written interlineally, in a secondary hand: fols. 9r, 133v, 136r, 160v, 161r, 162r. - Corrections written over erasures, in the main hand and in a secondary hand: fols. 7r, 66v, 69v, 72r, 99r, 100r, 101r, 115r, 127v, 128r, 131r, 145r, 146v, 153r, 153v, 165rb, 165vb, 171rb, 171vab, 175vb, 177ra. - Erasures marked with thin lines: fols. 127v, 152r, 163v, 165rb, 165va, 167rb, 172ra, 173vab, 174vb. - Scribbles: 1r, 3r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Daily readings are indicated by the names of the days of the week written in the upper margin, in a secondary crude hand, the same which added supplication formulas: ስኑይ፡ fol. 5r ዘስሉስ፡ fol. 29r ዘረቡዕ፡ fol. 55v ዘሐሙስ፡ fol. 77v ዘዓርብ፡ fol. 108v ዘዕሁድ፡ fol. 139r ዘቀደም፡ fol. 179r.
